boardgame.name: Imagym
boardgame.description:
A Picture is Worth a Thousand Words

Imagym is a game which consists in drawing words your opponent will try to figure out and in figuring out the words your opponent will have drawn. In order to line up your tokens on the game board and to win the game, you will have to use your imagination as well as your sense of observation and of strategy.

In turn, each opponent picks an indicator card and a 'difficulty' card, examines them, finds the word he/she has to draw on the game board and then places the cards, face down, in front of him/her. Each opponent draws his/her word on a sheet of his/her drawing pad. When all drawings are completed, each opponent shows his/her drawing to the others, long enough for them to try and figure out the word drawn. You get tokens for figuring out opponent word drawings and when they figure out your drawings.

The Winner is the player or the team which is the first to line up 4 tokens on the game board, either horizontally, vertically or diagonally.

boardgame.name: Fluxx Remixx
boardgame.description:
Fluxx Remixx is a card game in which the cards themselves determine the current rules of the game. By playing cards, you change numerous aspects of the game: how to draw cards, how to play cards, and even how to win.

At the start of the game, each player holds three cards and on a turn a player draws one card, then plays one card. By playing cards, you can put new rules into play that change numerous aspects of the game: how many cards to draw or play, how many cards you can hold in hand or keep on the table in front of you, and (most importantly) how to win the game.

Fluxx Remixx uses all the Keepers from regular Fluxx, but everything else is re-imagined, with a new set of Goals using different combinations of Keepers, along with new Rules, Actions, and Surprises.

boardgame.name: Druid Games
boardgame.description:
Every seven summers the druid games take place. In them, druids from different areas use their skills to command creatures in tactical confrontations. (No animals or legendary creatures are harmed in the games)

Druid Games is a simple card game (played with a 54 card deck) in which each player will play combinations of cards across five terrains. The druid that is victorious in three or more of them is proclaimed the winner of that edition of the Druid Games. Different creatures have specific characteristics (fly, swim, walk) that might limit the terrains in which they can be played. Additionally special cards allows some 'druid magic' to take place. Yes, you can give wings to a walrus to have a flying walrus.
Gameplay:
Each turn a player will place a creature card on one of the five terrains and, if desired, play special cards to produce 'druid magic' effects. The game will finish after all creature cards have been played (15 turns). The winner will be the druid that is victorious in three or more terrains.

boardgame.description: Cards which upgrade the first print run of British vs Pirates Volume 1 to work with British vs Pirates Volume 2

boardgame.name: British vs Pirates: Volume 2 – Lost Treasure of Dantes
boardgame.description:
This PDF download is a single player voyage where you will find 4 Chapters of rich storyline that will test your might in ship combat vs the evil NPC (non player control). As you complete each Chapter you'll receive SPECIAL CARDS for that faction that may be used in other game modes!

All of this content is digital and printable, or you may simply reference the PDF while you play. Requires British vs Pirates Volume 2.

boardgame.name: Tribute
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Tribute is a lonely game in which you explore love, loss, and permanence using a discarded or scavenged bone, found objects and artistry, and the daily weather’s fickle oracle. A single player will start by focusing on a lingering loss of love (fictional or real) and create a tribute to that loss by decorating the bone.

boardgame.name: A Visit to San Sibilia
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A Visit to San Sibilia is a solo journaling game in which you roleplay a character chronicling their visit to the city of San Sibilia. It is a city not found on any maps - San Sibilia is both part of and distinct from our world. The city manifests itself differently to every visitor.

User summary:

The game is distributed as two PDF files:

14-page game document
1-page "Alternative ending rules"

boardgame.name: What's So Cool About Hulijings?
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Hulijings (lit. fox spirits) are beautiful tricksters in Chinese folklore. They are master thieves and seducers aided by their cantrips, and are often seen indulging in acts of hedonism.

In this game, you create your own hulijings to take part in daring heists.

boardgame.name: Writers in the Darkness
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Writers in the Darkness ​is an immersive, Lovecraft inspired horror RPG played by writing physical letters between two people. The GM writes letters as The Writer, a character who is stuck in a terrifying situation, desperate for guidance to save them from a nightmarish threat. The player responds by writing letters as a friend, ex-lover, former enemy or associate of The Writer, offering advice and guidance to try and help them escape the situation with their life and discover the truth behind what is going on.

For this game the Gamemaster (GM) will require a 20-sided dice (d20) and six-sided dice (d6), while the player will need no dice. They will both require writing supplies and the ability to send letters through the post to each other. The game can also be played over email or any other medium that allows the sending of letter-like messages if they prefer this

boardgame.name: Dawning Horror
boardgame.description:
Dawning Horror is an expansion for Four against the Great Old Ones. It contains 5 programmed adventures, each featuring an Investigator and a team of three Helpers. The adventures are:

The Horror of the Mine
Howl of the Mutated
Night Tour
Return to Antarctica
The Inheritance


This expansion is a prequel to Four against the Great Old ones, since the heroes are peeking beyond the veil of sanity and normality for the first time, and advantages gained in Dawning Horror can be transferred to the main game in the form of Upgraded Investigators. It can be played with Investigators from the base game, Carcosa Rising, or from two brand new classes: the Archaeologist and the Redeemed Cultist.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Four against the Great Old Ones

boardgame.name: Weaver
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In an earlier time, when the world was only stories, you were the one who wrote them into existence. You had the entire palette of the unknown infinity to pull threads from, and the unbound existence to weave your tapestries onto.

But humans have turned almost every corner, science has bounded the infinite, and stories are cherished only by children. Your power has passed.

Almost.

boardgame.name: Sois l'Arbre / Ne Coup Pas l'Arbre
boardgame.description:
User summary:

This item presents a single, French-language document that includes:

Be the Tree
Don't Cut The Tree


The document is formatted to enable booklet printing.

boardgame.name: Session Zero
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Session Zero is a game about characters. It is the story of the life they have already lived before your story with them begins. It is who they are, who has helped them, what has benefited them, and what has caused them harm.

User summary:

The game uses special Session Zero cards, but a standard French-suited pack of cards can easily be substituted, using tables included in the game.

The game is distributed as a game document and a ZIP archive containing numerous print-and-play card images.

boardgame.name: Session Zero Expansion
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This is an expansion to the game Session Zero. Included in this expansion are 26 new prompts in two new suits.

User summary:

The game expansion uses special Session Zero cards.

The game is distributed as a game document and a ZIP archive containing numerous print-and-play card images.

boardgame.name: Hieronymous
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In Hieronymous, you play a group of refugees fleeing an astral terror known only as the Follower. As it pursues you, you rip your way through reality into strange worldscapes inspired by the paintings of the medieval artist Hieronymous Bosch, the Follower only a few steps behind.

What will happen when it catches up to you? What strange worlds will it tear apart in its pursuit? Is there a way home?

boardgame.name: ToT Dice
Trick or Treat Dice
boardgame.description:
It's Halloween, and it's time to go trick-or-treating!

The aim of the game is to get as much candy as you can, while running away from grumpy neighbors. The game consists of 13 dice — 12 white (treat) dice and 1 orange (trick) die. There are 6 different kinds of candy to collect that fall into 3 types; chocolate, lollipop or gummy.

A player's turn involves repeating two phases — rolling and collecting — until all the dice are set aside. When the dice are rolled, you must first set aside all Grumps. You can then choose any number of Runs to set aside, keeping in mind if there are more Grumps than Runs at the end of your turn, you get 0 points. You then choose any amount of one kind of candy to collect, each worth one point. On the orange die, a Double Trouble must be set aside and requires two Runs to escape. Tricks are worth nothing and can be re-rolled. If you roll a Mystery Candy, you choose at the end of your turn which candy it represents, as different combinations of collected candy get you bonus points!

The first person to get 23 points triggers the end of the game, and the person with the most points at the end of that round wins.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Die Baumeister von Köln
The Master Builders of Cologne
boardgame.description:
Die Baumeister von Köln is a board game for two to four players set in medieval Cologne, Germany. The theme is the construction of the city's 12 large Romanesque churches. Players must use their two carts each to bring building stones from the city gates to the construction sites on a historical city map. There they unload their cargo. Whoever has contributed the highest value of building stones to the construction of a building receives points upon its completion. At the beginning of each turn, dice are rolled to determine which building stone will be delivered to which city gate. The players try to block each other's paths in the city with their carts in order to be faster than the others. Encounter cards bring historical figures such as abbots, abbesses, mayors, thieves, etc. into play, allowing interaction with the other players.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Bad Aim
boardgame.description:
Bad Aim isn’t your regular “sit around a table” adult board game. It’s a WTF-just-happened, unpredictable action game for adults where two teams race to shoot down targets that contain outrageous challenge cards. The first team to shoot down their targets wins, while the losing team is forced to complete the challenges left standing. Bottom line? Those with bad aim will be shamed. This adult party game will have you questioning your friends’ sanity, and quite possibly, all of humanity.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Disney Mickey Mouse: Photorallye
boardgame.description: A game of collecting sets of photographs of famous Disney cartoon characters - Mickey Mouse, Pluto, Donald Duck and more - by exploring the Disney village. Players roll dice and try to move quickly and capture the right shot before their opponents do. Those with the sharpest tactics will prevail, and need to keep their wits about them.

boardgame.name: Rainbow River
boardgame.description:
Rainbow River is a grid-movement tableau-building game where players compete to get the most resources from an ever-changing board, with a unique setup for each game. Players play as explorers trying to piece together a cohesive map of the mystical rainbow river and fighting over map scraps.

You start with a randomized board and a unique Preference card. As the game develops, the board will shrink, and players will attempt to collect map tiles that will advance their river.

Build the longest river in order to secure victory!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: O Gran Magosto
boardgame.description:
The Apalpador and his friends are organizing a big "magosto" so they need to go out into the woods to look for chestnuts. Who will get more? In this game for the whole family you must use your favorite characters on each round to be the player who collects the most chestnuts and get the title of Master Chestnut.

Each player will draw cards from the deck to collect as many chestnuts as possible before three hedgehogs appear among their collection. The cards show chestnuts or hedgehogs. The player draws cards until his turn is over, when the player decides to stop drawing them or three hedgehogs have appeared. In the first case, the player will choose one of those cards for his reserve; on the other hand, in the second, he will lose all the cards that he has obtained.
The player with the most chestnuts at the end of the game will be the winner of the game.

boardgame.name: Ski Jumping
boardgame.description:
In this game emotions, tension, but also joy and well-being await you, just as you like it during real races. In the game you will start training the physical and mental qualities of your jumper. You will manage its energy, which will be important in racing. Of course, you will jump from a ski jumping hill with a realistic-looking jumper figure.
As in real jumps, you will solve not only the length of the jump, but also the style and point evaluation of the judges. Your jumps will also be affected by the wind and also the equipment in which you will jump.
The aim of the game is to place as best as possible in the individual races of the cup tour and become its overall winner.

At the beginning, each player slides the jumper's figure from the hill, and based on the distance determined by the rollers, we determine the order in which the player's cards are selected. Each of them have certain predispositions such as psyche, speed, technique, etc. Once we have chosen the player's card, we go to choose the flag of which nationality you want to represent. There is also a card draw on which hill we will jump. They are shuffled, then turn. So let's say it's going to be Japan, for example. This card is placed on the 3D hill and indicates to us what nation we jump in. Based on that, the home jumpers will benefit from a better meters rating simulating crowd support. And then the size of the hill is randomly selected by turning over the top card of the bridge and finding out that we are racing on the K90 hill, for example. Then we can go into the training of our ski jumper (players cards). Based on the different predispositions of individual jumpers, we can improve individual training skills, which happens in specialized rooms in gyms on the board and therefore we can choose which ability we want to improve. They are on special cards. This gains points on the player's card, but we lose time and energy while we train. And as we lose time, we gradually get closer to the day of the race, and as soon as we get to the seventh day, we can go jump from the hill. Before the race starts and we go jumping, we calculate the points we have gathered in training and then we will find it on the spinner table. According to the hill on which the race is held. And if we had the same nationality as the flag on the hill, we would get more bonus meters. Which is like fans support us. So, after entering the values, you can jump. Jumping is made by putting your plastic figure down from the hill. At the edge of the hill there are two rollers which are triggered by the plastic figure and there have plus and minus symbol and numbers. These rollers simulate so-called random weather factor such as the Wind, or the current mental state of the jumper, etc. If we jumped +1 point. We will write down all those things in a notebook and in the final evaluation of the jump, in addition to the points gained in training, the place where the jumper finished will also be recorded. We have different point areas. The possibility of falling is incorporated into the game. If the jumper does not reach the point area or fall, he will not get any points. But he also has another way to get points for style as in real, and these are the cards that represent the points we know from ski jumping. The points work by dealing 5 cards to the player, he does not look at them. Another five cards are dealt in front of him, and after turning the hourglass, which has a limit of 30 seconds, the player tries to find the best possible numbers in order to get the best points for style. After matching the cards, the highest and the lowest value is deleted, as it works in real races. The remaining three values ​​on the cards are summed up and written down in a notebook. All entered values ​​are then summed up on a special designed notebook so you don't have to remember all you data and the winner gets one of the trophies.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Dobbel Honkbal
boardgame.description:
This is an easy dice game simulating a baseball game.
The outcome of the a dice roll with two dice determines the outcome of every at bat.

boardgame.name: Prison Simulator
boardgame.description:
Prison Simulator is a first-person simulation game that puts a bit more emphasis on story than similar titles in the genre. In the game, you play a prison guard, and now it’s up to you whether you’ll abide by the law or let this place and its inhabitants corrupt you. After all, who said you had to be a model guard? Perhaps, instead you prefer to trade with prisoners, help them smuggle, and bet on the outcome of prison fights? After all, everyone likes to have a good time. Especially in a sad place like this, where you are also the boss. Or at least you think you are. So, what now? Do you choose to follow the rules, intercept contraband, count prisoners, put them to work, take care of their basic needs, and keep prison gangs under control? Or do you switch to the dark side? Whatever you choose, remember that your actions will have an impact on the facility itself, the inmates, and most importantly, the rest of your career.

Unique features of the game:


Try to find a balance between following your superiors’ orders and doing small favors for the inmates. In this way, you’ll maintain a fragile balance between the two and benefit from the gratitude of both parties.
Become a model prison guard in the Campaign mode. Accept new prisoners, search the cells for contraband to confiscate, view surveillance footage, maintain peace and order, respond to disobedient prisoners, and perform many other tasks assigned to you by your superiors.
Or ignore all the rules in Free Play mode. Do whatever you want, discover the most remote corners of the prison, explore the environment, and interact with the prisoners. Just remember that your actions will affect both the prison guards and the prisoners themselves. Especially if you punish the latter frequently and for no apparent reason.


Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Theosis: Godslayer
boardgame.description: This box contains one large miniature of a female hero wielding a spear and mounted on a winged dragon.

boardgame.name: If On A Winter's Night, Four Travelers
boardgame.description: If On A Winter's Night, Four Travelers is a narrative-driven point-and-click adventure that explores the stories of four different characters in a masked ball taking place on a train in the late 1920s.

boardgame.name: Twilight: 2000 Referee's Screen
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A deluxe Referee's screen in landscape format for the fourth edition of the Twilight: 2000 roleplaying game. It features beautiful art on the outside and a host of useful tables and important information on the inside, while keeping the Referee's plans hidden from the eyes of inquisitive players.

boardgame.name: Doorway to the Red Star
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Soar above a planet of adventure! The trail of a long-vanished ally leads to the other side of a magical portal called the Doorway to the Red Star. The heroes must earn the trust of the portal's guardians then travel through it—to another planet of red sands and high adventure! Working to gain allies among scholarly brain-people and shifty ratfolk, the heroes must infiltrate a massive airship and fight to free their ally from an insidious trap on an alien world!

“Doorway to the Red Star” is a Pathfinder adventure for four 15th-level characters. This adventure continues the Strength of Thousands Adventure Path, a six-part, monthly campaign in which the heroes rise from humble magic academy students to become influential teachers, and ultimately decide the fate of the Magaambya. This adventure also details people, places, and monsters of Akiton, the Red Planet, a fabulous setting for sword-and-sorcery escapades!

boardgame.name: The Ghost Pirates
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Bring your players on a journey with the Mortzestus - a doomed ship plagued by ill luck. But it is truly just misfortune, or is the ship being hunted? Find out in this adventure of nautical horror inspired by the novel by William Hope Hodgson.

This is not a combat heavy adventure - it is focused on roleplay, investigation and - eventually - survival. They cannot save the ship, but a diligent party may be able to find the cause and prevent it from happening again.

The adventure is also system agnostic - giving guideline for how difficult certain tasks should be rather than specific numbers, to allow you to use it for whatever system you like.

boardgame.name: Deadzone (Third Edition)
boardgame.description:
ENTER THE DEADZONE

Deadzone takes place in containment zones – cities or whole planets that have been erased from planetary maps and left for dead. You control an elite team of soldiers ready to enter the potentially lethal Deadzone and scavenge for whatever lucrative resources you can find. But competition is fierce, and other Strike Teams will be out to thwart you on your mission. Get in, get out, get rich, or get dead.

CINEMATIC, IMMERSIVE GAMEPLAY

Deadzone uses an innovative cube-based system for movement and shooting. Throw your tape measures in the garbage because you’re never going to need them again! Apart from DIY, of course. Models can be moved anywhere in a cube, which ensures you can make the best use of cover and obstacles to avoid the enemy, and movement takes seconds, rather than minutes. Shooting is just the same – measure the distance in cubes and, if you can see it, you can shoot it! Wargaming has never been this fast or cinematic.

MORE THAN 5 YEARS OF RULES DEVELOPMENT

Since the release of Deadzone: Second Edition in 2016, we’ve been refining the rules to make them faster and more streamlined. Third Edition incorporates all the changes and improvements made in the previous Outbreak and Escalation supplements, along with a host of other refinements. This is the Deadzone you love… just better. If you’ve never played before… well you’ve just found your new favourite game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Daniel
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The result of a failed attempt to create a flesh golem, Daniel is a unique creature. It wanders as though it were lost, a rolling mass of flesh and bone, accumulating debris as it goes. Better not get too close though, or it may share its joy with you...

boardgame.name: Carsus
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Carsus is dying.

He is nearly 800 years old and infected with the incurable fungus and will do anything to stave off the infection and find a cure. Anything.

boardgame.name: Verreaux
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

VIOLENCE IS HIS GOSPEL!

The vicious and violent Verreaux tramples all opponents before him! Commanding an entire orc army, he seeks out new lands to conquer and control.

boardgame.name: Tussentenner
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The mighty Jarl Tussentenner was once considered tiny by hill giant standards, but now that he's become a werewolf, other giants better watch their step. Surrounded by his were-creature minions, Tussentenner is a force to be reckoned with and an excellent villain to add to your 5e campaigns.

boardgame.name: Gollythank
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A disgruntled gnomish toymaker who commands an army of terrifying toys. Better watch out, better not die...

What is the Big Bad Booklet?

The Big Bad Booklet is a fully illustrated, color printed 9" x 6" booklet featuring a new boss monster that includes details about the boss's back story, personality, and tactics.

boardgame.name: Akkadia
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Known to the authorities as "The Mirror Mage," Akkadia has her eye on stealing the rarest and most dangerous magic items from across the realm. Why is she collecting them, and how does she seem to be in three places at once? If you love adventure, mystery and intrigue, be sure to bring Akkadia into your 5e campaign.
